hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: Is it convenient to talk at the moment? aetnamedicare.com 2017 The calls for greater punishment for diving are growing after Ashley Young's yellow card against Crystal Palace. It is, however, a notoriously difficult offence for a referee to call instantly and correctly in the high tempo of a match unless it is an open-and-shut case, as with Young. There may be a stronger case for inflicting increased retrospective punishment on the offender when it is an obvious dive, as Young's was. The player involved has history - Young was taken to task by his former United manager Sir Alex Ferguson for a similar incident in 2012, and he can have no complaints should he be hit with a suspension.
